page.title: 05FORESTRY _ CONTD
page.content: The forester must treat all stumps with fungicide within half an hour otherwise the spores will attach themselves to other healthy trees. This disease can cause a serious loss of wood production. By far the most damage, however, is caused by rabbits. Since 1953 and 1954 the disease Mixamatosis has helped to control the rabbit population but there are growing numbers again and they take the buds from young trees which is stunting their growth. Another problem from the wildlife of the forest arises from the roe deer. They brouse on trees in winter. In early summer they drag their antlers through the branches in order to strip the velvet off them. They attack both conifers and hardwoods alike in this way.
